title: Lunch atop a Skyscraper
description: While New York's thousands rush to crowded restaurants and congested lunch counters for their noon day lunch, these intrepid steel workers atop the 70 story RCA building in Rockefeller Center get all the air and freedom they want by lunching on a steel beam with a sheer drop of over 800 feet to the street level. The RCA building is the largest office building in terms of office space in the world.

title: The Roaring Lion
description: Portrait of late United Kingdom Prime Minister, Winston Churchill.

title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
description: Painting from the Dutch Golden Age, portraying a woman looking at the viewer, wearing what looks like a pearl as an earring.

title: The Great Wave off Kanagawa
description: Hokusai's best-known painting. It depicts a tempestous sea with a giant wave to the left, three boats shaken by the waters, and Mount Fuji standing in the background.

title: Landscape with the Fall of Icarus
description: Depiction of Icarus falling into the ocean after flying too close to the sun. The composition shows his troubles as a sidenote to the daily lives of others.

title: Earthrise
description: Photograph of the Earth and Moon from the Apollo 8 mission.

title: Moonrise
description: Photograph of Hernandez, New Mexico. The moon is rising atop a group of buildings.

title: The Village Politicians
description: A depiction of people arguing inside a nineteenth century house.

title: Children Eating Grapes and a Melon
description: Murillo portrayed Seville's poverty through this painting of two kids sitting while eating.

title: The Little Fruitseller
description: A person selling fruits and vegetables, Murillo's works usually show his time's daily life.

title: A Grove of Tamarack Pine
description: Alternatively known as "Lodgepole Pines, Lyell Fork of the Merced River, Yosemite National Park," this photograph was taken by Adams near the beginning of his career at Yosemite National Park.

title: The Milkmaid
description: A depiction of a Dutch milkmaid pouring milk into a bowl.

title: The Swing
description: This painting depicts Renoir's brother, Norbert Goeneutte, and model Jeanne Samary. Samary stands on a swing hanging from a tree, while Goeneutte looks at her.

title: Luncheon of the Boating Party
description: A group of Renoir's friends converse on a balcony at the Maison Fournaise restaurant along the Seine river.

title: Pillars of Creation
description: Photograph of elephant trunks of interstellar gas and dust in the Eagle Nebula, in the Serpens constellation.

title: The Geographer
description: A geographer stands among papers, peering through a window. The model in this painting is the same as in another of Vermeer's works, "The Astronomer".
